commit.message: Change licensing information in README
Add 2-clause BSD license to tree

listinstalled: equery list syntax has changed

equery's list syntax has changed, so update the listinstalled command
and help to reflect the change.
Note that the syntax is probably closer to ipkg/opkg than any other package manager
Add creative quote to the end of the help for epkg-0.4

epkg: Add a much more thorough usage display

More thoroughly describes the usage of epkg and its subcommands.

epkg: Allow more passing of arbitrary parameters

This adds passing of supplied parameters to the verifyall and sysinfo
commands

epkg/verify*: Only show files which failed to pass

This passes -o to equery clean to limit output to only those files which
failed to pass the checks.

epkg/autoremove: New command

Does the standard emerge --depclean usually done after an upgrade pass

epkg/verifyall: Correct behavior

equery requires that we specify a glob pattern for the packages to
verify, so let's give it '*' so it does what we want.
Add dependency listing to README
Add manpage and Markdown manpage source
Add new commands to help/fallthrough and add short -s/-i/-r options for search/install/remove

epkg: better confirmation for clean

This gives a better confirmation request than what rm -I was providing,
and shows what $DISTDIR is set to as well

epkg: A better way to get DISTDIR from portage

This is definitely much less hacky than eval-ing a specific line from
emerge --info's output
Add authors to README
Add a README
Add some more commands, some reordering (sorry @dwfreed)
Add 2 small eastereggs :)

Merge pull request #3 from dwfreed/master

My changes for epkg v0.2

"$@" != "$*"

"$@" provides the behavior we want; "$*" doesn't
Implement autoclean and clean

Let's use case, because case looks much cleaner.

Also add dist-upgrade as an alternative of upgrade, and update the usage display to include everything.
Let's be less hacky, and allow passing parameters to any command
Merge pull request #1 from miramir/patch-1
Initial commit.
